text: The 2017 Bulgarian parliamentary elections were held in Bulgaria on 26 March 2017. They were originally scheduled for 2018, but the previous political parties could not form a government. So early elections were called.Bulgaria Heads for Early Elections Balkan Insight, 20 December 2016 Before the elections, Boyko Borisov resigned from his prime minister position after the Bulgarian presidential election, 2016. In order for a political party to win seats, they must receive at least 4% of the popular vote.Bulgaria IFES The pro-European Union party, GERB, won the most seats. The Bulgarian Socialist Party gained the most seats, while the Reformist Bloc lost all of their 23 seats. == Opinion polls == Below is the weekly average of opinion polls in 2017 towards the election. The dots at the end of the graph show the final results. == Results == Parliamentary election Parliamentary election Parliamentary election Parliamentary election Parliamentary election Choice Votes % Seats +/– GERB 1,147,283 32.65% 95 11 Bulgarian Socialist Party 955,490 27.20% 80 41 United Patriots 318,513 9.07% 27 3 Movement for Rights and Freedoms 315,976 8.99% 26 12 Volya 145,637 4.15% 12 12 others 542,705 15.45% 0 – None of the above 87,854 2.50% 0 – Total votes 3,513,458 100% 240 – == Aftermath == After the results, Boyko Borisov is expected to become prime minister again. == References == Category:Politics of Bulgaria Category:21st century in Bulgaria Category:2017 elections in Europe Category:March 2017 events
title: 2017 Bulgarian parliamentary election
